PROJECT INNOVATE
March 14, 1967
The Honorable Howard Cannon
U. S. Senator from Nevada
Senate Office Building
Washington, D. C. 20036
Dear Senator Cannon:
Thank you so much for the time you and Dr. Pitlick took with me to discuss the pending
ETV legislation and the status of the Nevada ETV project.
By now, you have probably had time to review both the Carnegie Commission Report and
the Bill, but I did want to let you Know rhar if you or your sraff have questions or wish
turther information, you should feel tree ro call any of the following at the office of the
National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB), 1346 Connecticut Avenue N.W.,
telephone 667-6000: Mr. William G. Hariey, President; Mr. C. Scott Fletcher, Execu¬
tive Consultant, or Mr. Chalmers H. Marquis, Jr., Executive Director of Educational
Television Stations, a division of the NAEB; and Mr. Jerrold Sandler, Executive Director
ot Narional Educational Radio, also a division or rhe NAEB. I have taxen the liberty of
giving your name to Mr. Sandler who has special material on the educational radio aspect
of the bill so he may give you a call in the near future.
I am well aware that Dr. Killian was hard to follow, but I hope our meeting helped bring
some of the salient points to your attention. However, the real ETV experts are in the
NAEB office and I am sure you will be able to get a great deal more information from con¬
versations with them.
Again, my thanks to you and Dr. Pitlick. I do hope we have the opportunity to meet again
soon and I shall look forward to receiving your newsletter.
Sincerely,
HELENA. SIDLER (Miss), Coordinator
Research and Development
